- Download QGIS from qgis.org or remote desktop
- Can download for Windows, Mac or Linux 
- Different versions and all quite similar: **3.22 LTR Recommended**

## Save your Project

You should save this as an QGIS project (.qgz extension)

- Click Project --> Save 
And save it in your Lab *Web Mapping and Analysis* folder 

## IMPORTANT

- You will need to save shapefiles and other layers separately
- The ‘Project’ Lab3.qgz is just a file which restores all the links to these datasests, and information about the way they are displayed. 
- If you move the source files (e.g. liverpool_bld.shp) they will get detached from your project and you have to relocate them

# R and R-Studio

- R is a statistical programming language developed for data analysis and visualization

- Rstudio is an IDE (Integrated Development Environment) 
- Write, save and open R Codes (.R & .Rmd files)
- Provides syntax-highlighting and auto-completion and much more
